docs.lead_paragraph: Items that Representative Eric Cantor had hoped would change the Republican Party’s look have been ignored or have only worsened party divisions.

headline.seo: House Majority Leader’s Quest to Soften G.O.P.’s Image Hits Wall
headline.main: House Majority Leader’s Quest to Soften G.O.P.’s Image Hits a Wall Within
headline.print_headline: House Majority Leader’s Quest to Soften G.O.P.’s Image Hits a Wall Within

docs.abstract: Rep Eric Cantor of Virginia, House majority leader, has been trying for months to remake image of Republican Party, from one of uncompromising conservatism to something kinder and gentler; items that he had hoped would change GOP's look have been ignored or have only worsened party divisions.
docs.snippet: Items that Representative Eric Cantor had hoped would change the Republican Party’s look have been ignored or have only worsened party divisions.

headline.main: The Bad Economy Behind the Health Care Slowdown

docs.abstract: A new study from the Kaiser Family Foundation helps sort out how much of the recent moderation in health care costs is related to causes other than the economy.
docs.snippet: A new study from the Kaiser Family Foundation helps sort out how much of the recent moderation in health care costs is related to causes other than the economy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The experience of a health system in Chicago shows how hard it will be to expand “accountable care” and keep costs from rising.

headline.seo: ‘Accountable Care’ Helping Hospitals Keep Medical Costs Down
headline.main: A Health Provider Strives to Keep Hospital Beds Empty
headline.print_headline: A Health Provider Finds Success In Keeping Hospital Beds Empty

docs.abstract: Illinois-based health system Advocate Health Care is pioneer in approach known as 'accountable care,' which offers financial incentives for doctors and hospitals to cut costs without restricting needed care; model adopted by Advocate has achieved small but significant savings, but fact that it may not be able to continue its progress offers example of challenges that industry will face if it adopts such an approach.
docs.snippet: The experience of a health system in Chicago shows how hard it will be to expand “accountable care” and keep costs from rising.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the people wounded in the Boston bombings could face staggering bills for care and rehabilitation, and compensation fund administrators must decide what to cover.

headline.seo: Price of Recovery May Place Another Burden on Boston Victims
headline.main: For Wounded, Daunting Cost; for Aid Fund, Tough Decisions
headline.print_headline: For Wounded, Daunting Cost; For Aid Fund, Tough Decisions

docs.abstract: Many people wounded in Boston Marathon bombings could face staggering bills for care and rehabilitation;  even those with health insurance may find that their plan places limits on specific services, like physical therapy or psychological counseling; Kenneth R Feinberg, lawyer who has overseen compensation funds for victims of many disasters, starts difficult work of deciding who will be eligible for payouts from compensation fund and how much each victim deserves.
docs.snippet: Many of the people wounded in the Boston bombings could face staggering bills for care and rehabilitation, and compensation fund administrators must decide what to cover.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Tuggle, the last pick in the 1983 N.F.L. draft, is still an inspiration to a teammate for the way he fought cancer and rallied his team.

headline.seo: Once the N.F.L. Draft’s Mr. Irrelevant, a Former Giant Still Inspires
headline.main: Once Mr. Irrelevant, a Giant Remains an Inspiring Force
headline.print_headline: Once Mr. Irrelevant, A Giant Remains An Inspiring Force

docs.abstract: John Tuggle, last pick in 1983 NFL draft, is still inspiration to former New York Giants teammate Rob Carpenter, for way he fought cancer and rallied his team.
docs.snippet: John Tuggle, the last pick in the 1983 N.F.L. draft, is still an inspiration to a teammate for the way he fought cancer and rallied his team.
